intro: Toxostigma luteum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a member of the Primulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. The plant features showy, five-petaled yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Toxostigma luteum is often found in woodland areas and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
